paragraphs.content: Chapter 26
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 26

paragraphs.content: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.

paragraphs.content: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.

paragraphs.content: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

paragraphs.content: Trust ye in the LORD for ever: for in the LORD JEHOVAH is everlasting strength:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Trust ye in the Lord for ever: for in the Lord Jehovah is everlasting strength:

paragraphs.content: ¶ For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.

paragraphs.content: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.

paragraphs.content: The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.

paragraphs.content: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O LORD, have we waited for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O Lord, have we waited for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.

paragraphs.content: With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

paragraphs.content: Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: LORD, when thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see, and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, when thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see, and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.

paragraphs.content: ¶ LORD, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Lord, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.

paragraphs.content: O LORD our God, other lords beside thee have had dominion over us: but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord our God, other lords beside thee have had dominion over us: but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.

paragraphs.content: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast increased the nation, O LORD, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast increased the nation, O Lord, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.

paragraphs.content: LORD, in trouble have they visited thee, they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, in trouble have they visited thee, they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.

paragraphs.content: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O Lord.

paragraphs.content: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

paragraphs.content: Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.

paragraphs.content: For, behold, the LORD cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, behold, the Lord cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
